page.title: 01Haddenham General Review
page.content: This block is part of the{Vale of {Aylesbury.}It contains the large village of{Haddenham,}hamlet of{Aston {Standford}and surrounding farm land. The village is{9km SW of Aylesbury. The village and its rector are recorded in the Domesday Book. A characteristic feature is the wichert (Saxon - white earth) walls of many buildings and lanes, topped by tiles or thatch. The village has 3 duck ponds, one at the south end of the village near the C13 church and village green. The village has many Georgian and Victorian houses, and some developments of new housing. The village has 2 first schools, a middle school, dentist, library, community centre and range of shops. Aston Stanford, 2km S of Haddenham, has a tiny timbered church.
